intro: Palafoxia cyanophylla, commonly known as blueleaf palafoxia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically blue-green in color. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes. Palafoxia cyanophylla is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
